story.title: Midnight Kiss - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Nora: It‚Äôs official, I don‚Äôt have anyone to kiss on New Year‚Äôs Eve.
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: It‚Äôs official, I don‚Äôt have anyone to kiss on New Year‚Äôs Eve.
You still have one hour until midnight!
Maybe a miracle will happen üçæ  ü•Ç
I doubt it. Pretty sure I‚Äôm the only person under the age of 60 at this party.
Why would your parents make you go to their friend‚Äôs boring New Year‚Äôs Eve party anyway?
Because they‚Äôre evil.
And they hate me.
üôÅ You should sneak out and come over here!
I can‚Äôt. This house is in the middle of nowhere.
Stay strong bb!
I‚Äôll text you later.
I have to find my own hottie to kiss at midnight üòò
Nora sighs as she slips her phone back into her pocket.
This party is the worst.
The music is horrible.
No one here is even close to her age.
And she doesn‚Äôt know what‚Äôs happening on the dance floor‚Ä¶
But it isn‚Äôt dancing.
Just as she goes slinking off to the corner to look at her phone again‚Äî
Nora spots someone who doesn‚Äôt have grey hair.
He looks her age‚Ä¶
And kinda cute.
Is that?
Yes, it‚Äôs Owen King.
They used to play as kids whenever their parents got together‚Ä¶
But she hasn‚Äôt seen him in at least ten years.
She had a crush on him when they were little‚Ä¶
And her seven-year-old self was convinced they would get married one day.
He looks all grown up now‚Ä¶
No more mud on his clothes‚Äî
His wild hair tamed.
But he still has that same crooked smile‚Ä¶
Only now it‚Äôs getting Nora‚Äôs heart pumping.
Nora keeps her eye on him as he strolls through the crowd.
When his gaze falls onto her, he suddenly stops walking.
Nora drops her eyes shyly as he moves toward her.
Nora?
Owen King.
You look fantastic.
Nora blushes.
Thanks.
Owen‚Äôs eyes lock onto Nora‚Äôs, giving her warm shivers.
I gotta say though, I miss your overalls.
You remember those? The purple ones?
Of course. I was so jealous of those overalls.
I think my mother still has them tucked away somewhere.
Do you think they would fit me?
Nora looks him up and down.
No longer scrawny, Owen‚Äôs body had filled out with strong arms and round shoulders.
They may be a tad small.
That‚Äôs a shame. Are you enjoying my parent‚Äôs wild party?
I thought parties were supposed to have music. What is this?
I think it‚Äôs the sound of baboons mating.
Nora snorts out a laugh.
I tried to hide my parent‚Äôs CD collection, but my Dad sniffed it out.
Actually, I have an idea‚Ä¶
Owen pulls his phone out of his pocket and plugs in his headphones.
Put that in your ear before your eardrums go on strike.
Nora places a bud in her ear.
Owen puts the other bud in his own ear and chooses a song‚Ä¶
Thankfully one that came out in the last year.
I love this song.
It usually sounds better without a horrible song playing in the background.
Nora can‚Äôt stop smiling as they move closer to each other, listening to the music.
It‚Äôs not so bad.
Owen smiles and then looks out at the other guests on the dance floor.
Who do you think will be the first one to break a hip?
Nora laughs.
Definitely that lady with the long pearl necklace.
That‚Äôs my Aunt Susan. She annihilated the tray of Jell-O shots.
It looks like it.
What about that guy with the thick glasses?
He‚Äôs going to knock someone out with the way he‚Äôs swinging his arms.
I think you‚Äôre right. This is going to get ugly fast.
Nora grins.
So how come you‚Äôre stuck here tonight?
Aren‚Äôt your friends having a party?
Yeah, but my parents think that New Year‚Äôs Eve should be a family holiday.
My parents wouldn‚Äôt let me go out either.
I‚Äôm glad for that.
Owen smiles, making Nora blush again.
Me too.
He takes her hand and gives it a squeeze, making her heart flutter.
They talk and laugh, and even do some awkward dancing of their own.
Nora glances down at her watch.
Oh my God, it‚Äôs almost midnight.
Seven minutes left.
Nora was so wrapped up in her own little world with Owen that she completely lost track of time.
Now she‚Äôs dreading the moment the party comes to an end.
Here comes my mom with the horns and hats.
Owen‚Äôs mother was placing colorful party hats on all of the guest‚Äôs heads.
Come on, let‚Äôs hide before she sees us.
Owen leads Nora into a somewhat secluded corner of the room.
The excitement is building all around them as someone turns on the TV.
Everyone gathers around to watch the ball drop.
One minute to go‚Ä¶
Nora‚Äôs pulse races as the seconds tick by.
She and Owen keep nervously catching each other‚Äôs eyes‚Ä¶
Trying to read the other‚Äôs thoughts.
Is he going to kiss her?
Should she kiss him?
The crowd starts counting down.
Happy New Year!
As the crowd erupts in cheers around them, Owen turns to Nora‚Ä¶
His eyes search her face with longing, roaming from her green irises to her rose red lips.
Happy New Year, Nora.
He leans in and presses his lips to hers‚Ä¶
Gentle at first‚Ä¶
Until Nora places a hand on the back of his neck‚Äî
Pulling him into a a deep, passionate kiss, that has her body melting into his.
When they finally break apart, Owen‚Äôs eyes are bright, his cheeks flushed.
I think 2019 is going to be a very good year.
And, with the brightest smile spreading across her lips, Nora pulls him in for another kiss.
It was definitely a Happy New Year.
